Mills.Action: Calmly confronts two thugs attempting to break into a car, stays composed and assesses the situation before acting.
Uses swift and effective physical combat skills to subdue both thugs despite being attacked from behind, adapting to the fight dynamically.
Insists on staying at the crime scene despite instructions to assist officers; shines flashlight in Somerset's eyes and then leaves.
Punches the heavy bag with hard, quick punches, skillfully boxing while under observation.
Demonstrates physical capability and confidence by warming up and actively engaging Somerset in boxing practice.
Asserts his experience and skill by stating his time in homicide and defending his competence.
Pushes aggressively but without fully respecting Somerset's reluctance, revealing possible overconfidence.
Attempts to read Dante's Purgatory attentively but fails to understand it and reacts with frustration.
Quickly accepts and uses Cliff Notes to overcome lack of understanding and continue his work.
Hides his Cliff Notes quickly when Somerset looks over, attempting to conceal his lack of preparedness.
Answers the phone professionally as Detective Mills, listens carefully, and hands it over to Somerset when confused.
Successfully shot an armed suspect with one shot between the eyes, leading to a medal and public recognition.
Remembers the traumatic experience clearly and reflects on his ability and luck in handling the situation.
Is confident and calm afterward, stating he slept like a baby despite taking a human life.
Keeps looking despite lack of evidence, pushes team to find clues.
Abrupt demeanor toward Somerset suggesting impatience or poor teamwork.
Volunteers to accept a guilty plea under specific conditions to resolve a tense situation.
Follows Somerset's advice to stay cold and unemotional while preparing for a difficult task.
Makes an awkward, unexpected personal comment to Somerset despite the serious situation.
Attempts to pursue John Doe immediately after he disappears into the water, entering the underground waterway despite the danger.
Fires futile shots into the water, holding a microphone out of his bullet-proof vest, showing desperation but also presence of mind to keep communication.
Is carried by the strong current, battered and struggling to swim, showing limited control of the situation.
Emerges disoriented but alert, waving his gun expecting confrontation, shows determination and readiness.
Moves cautiously and intently through a complex underground waterworks area, scanning tunnels and catwalks, demonstrating situational awareness and readiness.
Points and fires his gun into a tunnel, attempting to provoke or flush out an adversary, showing tactical initiative.
Despite being shot multiple times, twists and tries to return fire, showing resilience and fighting spirit.
Gets shot multiple times in the back and eventually collapses, gun falling from his hand, indicating he was outmatched or caught off guard.
